column4: Hey guys! Where would I copy an application if i want to run it? /usr/bin/, /bin/, /sbin/ ? Thanks in advance
don't put it anywhere unless you want it to be system wide, just leave it in your home directory
system wide yes, i would like to run it from anywhere
it is a VOIP soft phone.
so, put it in /home/user/bin and add that to your permanent PATH in .bashrc
thnaks
or, install it to /usr/local/bin
the install script should handle that part, though
it does not install, just runs
sounds like a poorly designed package, IMO
what softphone is this?
http://storage.counterpath.com/downloads/X-Lite_Install.tar.gz?platform=linux&product=xlite
X-Lite
XLite didn't work for me the last time I tried it.  You may want to run it in place before you copy it to your system folders
it usually works for me on my systems
IIRC X-lite is no longer being maintained, so good luck!
...at least the Linux port isn't
IIRC ?
If I Remember Correctly
sure is, v4 is coming out :D
and by the way, it is one of the softphones that works out of the box with sipxecs
